segments.text: I notice the boy stretching for the cookie jar, barely keeping his balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is so unstable—it’s making me nervous just looking at it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing nearby, waiting for a cookie like it’s the most normal thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying dishes, completely unaware of what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everyone is in this situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and the floor is getting slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy could fall at any moment, and no one would even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman ever pays attention to what’s going on around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off the faucet before the water ruins the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a mess, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR
